name: revulsion

a strong, often sudden, feeling that something is extremely unpleasant: I turned away in revulsion when they showed a close-up of the operation. She looked at him with revulsion. He expressed his revulsion at/against/towards the whale hunting. Synonyms
horror
repulsion
revolt (UNPLEASANT FEELING)
